Package eventorganizer

Class Date

java.lang.Object
eventorganizer.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Date>
public class Date extends Object implements Comparable<Date>
This class represents a calendar date with methods to determine if input is valid, if a date is in the future, if a date is within six months of the current date, a method for comparing two dates, and methods for testing.
Author:
Jason Lei, Jerlin Yuen

  • Constructor Details

    • Date

      public Date(int year, int month, int day)
      Parameterized constructor
      Parameters:
      year - - date's year
      month - - date's month
      day - - date's day

  • Method Details

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Determines if a date is a valid calendar date based on different criteria such as the number of days in a month, whether a year is a leap or non-leap year, if the year is a negative value, month is a value less than 1, and if month is a value greater than 12.
      Returns:
      true if the date is a valid calendar date, false otherwise

    • isFuture

      public boolean isFuture()
      Checks to see if an event date is a future date
      Returns:
      true if the date is a future date, false otherwise

    • isUnder6Months

      public boolean isUnder6Months()
      Checks to see if an event date is no more than 6 months away from the current date
      Returns:
      true if the date is less than or equal to 6 months away from the current date, false otherwise

    • isLeapYear

      private boolean isLeapYear()
      Checks to see if a year is a leap year or a non-leap year
      Returns:
      true if the year is a leap year, false otherwise

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Date otherDate)
      Compares the years, months, and days of two dates
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Date>
      Parameters:
      otherDate - - second date to be compared to
      Returns:
      0 if years, months, and days are the same, -1 if year, months, or days is before the second date, 1 if year, months, or days is after the second date

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns textual representation of date in Month/Day/Year
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      textual representation of date
